Problem:
Consider the integral transform defined by \\( F(x) = \\int_0^x e^{t^2} dt \\). We study the implications of modifying this integral using a linear transformation of the variable x given by the function \\( g(x) = ax + b \\), where a and b are constants.

If at some x = t, an intervention modifies x to \\( h(x) = cx + d \\) (c and d are constants), then will \\( F(cx + d) \\) depend only on the original transformation properties a and b?
Explanation: The new transformation \\( h(x) = cx + d \\) as an intervention alters the basis of calculation for the transform \\( F \\). Thus, \\( F(cx + d) \\) will depend on the new constants c and d as well as the original a and b, reflecting changes from both transformations.
